Beginner.concept: Stack follows LIFO (Last In First Out).
Beginner.visual: Push adds element to top. Pop removes from top.

Intermediate.concept: Stack can be implemented using Arrays or Linked Lists.
Intermediate.visual: Array stack uses index pointer. Linked list stack uses head pointer.
Intermediate.java: Array-based stack implementation with top pointer.

Advanced.concept: Advanced stack usage: DFS, Expression evaluation, Monotonic stack.
Advanced.visual: Used in recursion call stack and algorithm design.
Advanced.java: Stack implementation using custom Linked List.

Beginner.concept: Queue follows FIFO (First In First Out).
Beginner.visual: Enqueue at rear. Dequeue from front.

Intermediate.concept: Queue types: Circular Queue, Priority Queue.
Intermediate.visual: Circular queue connects last index to first.

Advanced.java: Queue used in BFS traversal program.

Beginner.concept: Linear search checks elements one by one.
Beginner.visual: Start from index 0 until match found.

Intermediate.concept: Time complexity: O(n). Best case O(1).
Intermediate.visual: Worst case when element is last.

Beginner.visual: Largest element bubbles to end each pass.

Intermediate.visual: After each pass, one element sorted.
